metadata.title: CVE-2013-5915 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The RSA-CRT implementation in PolarSSL before 1.2.9 does not properlyperform Montgomery multiplication, which might allow remote attackers toconduct a timing side-channel attack and retrieve RSA private keys.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-5915` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmbedcrypto0 - 1.3.4-1
libmbedtls10 - 1.3.4-1
libmbedx509-0 - 1.3.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mbedtls package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.4-1').
